app.title: WSL Cleaner
menu.title: Menu
error.notInstalled: WSL 2 is not installed or no distribution was found.
error.optimizeVhd: Optimize-VHD is not available. Enable the Hyper-V PowerShell module via Windows Features.
error.wslNotInPath: WSL is not installed or not in your system PATH. Install it with "wsl --install" from an elevated terminal.
error.wslNotInstalled: WSL is not installed. Run "wsl --install" from an elevated terminal.
error.distroNotFound: The selected WSL distribution was not found. It may have been renamed or removed.
error.virtDisabled: Hardware virtualization is disabled. Enable VT-x/AMD-V in your BIOS settings.
error.hyperV: Hyper-V is not enabled. Enable it in Windows Features and reboot.
error.permission: Permission denied. Try running the app as Administrator, or check that no other program is using the file.
error.cmdNotFound: Required command not found. Make sure the necessary tools and PowerShell modules are installed.
error.timeout: A network operation timed out. Check your internet connection and try again.
error.noDistros: No WSL 2 distributions found. Please install a WSL 2 distro first.
error.wslNotAvailable: WSL 2 is not installed or not available. Please install WSL 2 first.
simple.desc: Clean your WSL instance and compact the virtual disk to reclaim space.
simple.disclaimer: This deletes files & old dependency directories. Use Settings to control exactly what will be cleaned. Designed for WSL partitions used for development.
settings.tasksDesc: Choose which cleanup tasks the Cleaner will run. Your selections are saved automatically.
category.system.name: System
category.user-editor.name: User & Editor
category.pkg-managers.name: Package Managers
category.frameworks.name: Frameworks & Build
category.containers.name: Containers & DevOps
category.aggressive.name: Aggressive
settings.compactDesc: When enabled, the Cleaner will shut down WSL, update it, and compact the virtual disk after running cleanup tasks.
log.title: Output
log.trimFallback: TRIM finished (may have used zero-fill fallback).
log.uacPrompt: You may see a UAC elevation prompt.
stale.title: Stale Directories
stale.desc: Find and remove old dependency, build, and cache directories (node_modules, vendor, __pycache__, .next, .nuxt, .turbo, .yarn, target, .gradle, dist, .venv, and more) that haven't been modified recently. These are safe to delete — they'll be recreated automatically when you next build or install.
stale.daysLabel: Remove directories not modified in the last
stale.clean: No stale directories found. Your WSL filesystem looks clean!
stale.noneFound: No stale directories found (nothing older than {days} days).
stale.found_one: Found 1 stale directory — total estimated size: {size}
stale.found_other: Found {count} stale directories — total estimated size: {size}
compact.title: Disk Compaction
compact.desc: Shut down WSL, update it, and compact the virtual disk to reclaim unused space on your Windows drive.
compact.noVhdx: ✗ No VHDX file found. Cannot compact. The virtual disk may be in a non-standard location.
stats.title: Cleanup Stats
stats.desc: Track your cleanup history and see how much space you've recovered over time.
stats.diskEmpty: No compaction data yet. Run a cleanup to start tracking.
stats.savedEmpty: No sessions with space savings yet.
stats.historyEmpty: No cleanup history yet. Run a cleanup to start tracking your stats.
about.desc: A lightweight utility to clean, optimize, and compact your Windows Subsystem for Linux installation. Reclaim disk space with one click.
modal.aggressiveDesc: The following tasks will permanently destroy data that may be difficult or impossible to restore:
modal.aggressiveHint: These tasks are marked aggressive because they remove data beyond typical caches. Make sure you understand the consequences before proceeding.
diskmap.title: WSL Disk Usage
diskmap.scanningDesc: Running du inside WSL. This may take a moment for large filesystems.
diskmap.empty: Select a distro and click Scan to visualize disk usage.
diskmap.scanFailed: Disk scan failed. Make sure the distro is running.
health.title: WSL Health Dashboard
health.desc: Real-time system metrics for your WSL distributions.
health.empty: Select a distro to view health metrics.
health.error: Could not retrieve health data. Make sure the distro is running.
health.systemdDegraded: System is degraded — {count} service(s) have failed. This is common in WSL and usually harmless.
health.systemdHint: Run systemctl status {unit} or journalctl -u {unit} for full logs.
language.label: Language
sound.label: Sound Effects
task.apt-update.name: Update System Packages
task.apt-update.desc: Brings all system packages up to date. Uses dnf upgrade on Fedora/RHEL or apt-get update && upgrade on Debian/Ubuntu.
task.apt-clean.name: Clean Old Packages
task.apt-clean.desc: Removes orphaned packages and clears package caches. Uses dnf clean all && dnf autoremove on Fedora/RHEL or apt autoremove && clean on Debian/Ubuntu.
task.journal.name: Shrink Systemd Journal
task.journal.desc: Reduces journal log files to 10 MB and removes entries older than 2 weeks.
task.tmp.name: Clean Temporary Files
task.caches.name: Clean User Caches
task.caches.desc: Clears npm cache, pip cache, and browser caches (Mozilla, Chrome) from your home directory and /root.
task.rotated-logs.name: Clean Old Rotated Logs
task.rotated-logs.desc: Removes compressed and rotated log files (.gz, .old, .1) from /var/log.
task.truncate-logs.name: Truncate Active Log Files
task.truncate-logs.desc: Empties /var/log/syslog and all *.log files in /var/log without deleting them, freeing space while keeping the files intact for continued logging.
task.apt-lists.name: Clean Apt Package Lists
task.apt-lists.desc: Removes cached package lists from /var/lib/apt/lists. They are recreated on the next apt update. (Debian/Ubuntu only)
task.snap-cache.name: Clean Snap Cache
task.snap-old-revisions.name: Remove Old Snap Revisions
task.snap-old-revisions.desc: Removes disabled snap revisions sitting in /var/lib/snapd/snaps. Can reclaim several GB.
task.vscode-server.name: Clean VS Code / Cursor / Windsurf Server
task.vscode-server.desc: Removes extension caches and log files from ~/.vscode-server, ~/.cursor-server, and ~/.windsurf-server. Preserves extensions and settings.
task.vscode-old-bins.name: Clean Old VS Code / Cursor / Windsurf Server Binaries
task.vscode-old-bins.desc: Removes old server binaries from ~/.vscode-server/bin, ~/.cursor-server/bin, and ~/.windsurf-server/bin, keeping only the latest version. Each old version is ~200 MB.
task.trash.name: Empty Trash
task.trash.desc: Empties the desktop trash folder at ~/.local/share/Trash.
task.thumbnails.name: Clean Thumbnail Cache
task.yarn-cache.name: Clean Yarn Cache
task.yarn-cache.desc: Runs yarn cache clean to remove all cached Yarn packages.
task.go-cache.name: Clean Go Module Cache
task.go-cache.desc: Runs go clean -modcache to remove downloaded Go module files.
task.cargo-cache.name: Clean Cargo/Rust Registry Cache
task.cargo-cache.desc: Removes cached crate files from ~/.cargo/registry/cache and ~/.cargo/registry/src.
task.laravel-clean.name: Clean Laravel Logs & Cache
task.laravel-clean.desc: Finds Laravel projects under /home and /var/www and removes log files from storage/logs and disk cache from storage/framework/cache/data and storage/framework/views.
task.framework-caches.name: Clean Framework Build Caches
task.framework-caches.desc: Finds JS/TS projects and removes regenerable build caches: .next/cache, .angular/cache, node_modules/.cache, .svelte-kit, .tsbuildinfo files, and more.
task.rust-target.name: Clean Rust Build Artifacts
task.rust-target.desc: Finds Rust projects under /home and removes their target/ directories. Each project can have 1–10 GB in build output. Rebuilt on next cargo build.
task.android-cache.name: Clean Android SDK & Gradle Build Cache
task.android-cache.desc: Removes ~/.android/cache, ~/.android/build-cache, and Gradle project build/ directories. Mobile devs can have 5–20 GB here.
task.docker-prune.name: Clean Docker Dangling Artifacts
task.docker-prune.desc: Removes dangling (untagged) images, unused networks, and stale build cache. All named/tagged images, containers, and volumes are preserved.
task.pip-cache.name: Clean Pip Cache Directory
task.pnpm-cache.name: Clean pnpm Store
task.pnpm-cache.desc: Prunes the pnpm content-addressable store and removes temp files.
task.composer-cache.name: Clean Composer Cache
task.composer-cache.desc: Clears the PHP Composer download cache from ~/.cache/composer.
task.maven-cache.name: Clean Maven Cache
task.maven-cache.desc: Removes cached Maven artifacts from ~/.m2/repository. Can reclaim 5–15 GB for active Java projects.
task.gradle-cache.name: Clean Gradle Cache
task.gradle-cache.desc: Removes Gradle build caches and wrapper distributions from ~/.gradle.
task.conda-cache.name: Clean Conda Cache
task.conda-cache.desc: Removes unused Conda packages, tarballs, and cached downloads.
task.gem-cache.name: Clean Ruby Gems Cache
task.gem-cache.desc: Runs gem cleanup and removes cached gem files from ~/.gem.
task.nuget-cache.name: Clean NuGet Cache
task.nuget-cache.desc: Clears .NET NuGet package caches from ~/.nuget and local share.
task.deno-cache.name: Clean Deno Cache
task.deno-cache.desc: Removes cached remote modules and compiled files from ~/.cache/deno and ~/.deno/cache.
task.bun-cache.name: Clean Bun Cache
task.dart-cache.name: Clean Dart/Flutter Pub Cache
task.dart-cache.desc: Clears the Dart/Flutter package cache from ~/.pub-cache.
task.brew-cache.name: Clean Homebrew/Linuxbrew Cache
task.brew-cache.desc: Removes old downloads and formula from ~/.cache/Homebrew.
task.db-logs.name: Clean Database Logs
task.db-logs.desc: Removes MySQL/MariaDB and PostgreSQL log files from /var/log. Safe to clean on dev instances.
task.k8s-cache.name: Clean Kubernetes & Helm Cache
task.k8s-cache.desc: Removes kubectl API discovery cache from ~/.kube/cache and Helm chart cache from ~/.cache/helm.
task.editor-swap.name: Clean Vim/Neovim Swap & Undo Files
task.editor-swap.desc: Removes leftover swap, undo, and shada files from Vim and Neovim.
task.git-gc.name: Compact Git Repositories
task.git-gc.desc: Finds all git repos under /home and aggressively compacts them: expires reflog entries and repacks objects with maximum compression. Branches, tags, and reachable commits are untouched. Reflog recovery history is lost.
task.shell-caches.name: Clean Shell Completion Caches
task.shell-caches.desc: Removes Zsh completion dumps (~/.zcompdump*), oh-my-zsh cache, and Zsh session files. Rebuilt automatically.
task.jupyter-runtime.name: Clean Jupyter Runtime Files
task.jupyter-runtime.desc: Removes leftover kernel connection files and runtime data from ~/.local/share/jupyter/runtime.
task.ccache-clean.name: Clean ccache
task.ccache-clean.desc: Clears the C/C++ compiler cache from ~/.ccache. Can reclaim several GB.
task.bazel-cache.name: Clean Bazel Cache
task.bazel-cache.desc: Removes Bazel build cache from ~/.cache/bazel. Can be 10+ GB.
task.core-dumps.name: Clean Core Dumps & Crash Reports
task.core-dumps.desc: Removes crash reports from /var/crash and coredumps from /var/lib/systemd/coredump.
task.old-kernels.name: Remove Old Kernel Packages
task.old-kernels.desc: WSL uses its own kernel, so any installed linux-image, linux-headers, or linux-modules packages are dead weight. (Debian/Ubuntu only)
task.font-cache.name: Clean Font Cache
task.font-cache.desc: Removes font cache files from /var/cache/fontconfig and ~/.cache/fontconfig. Rebuilt automatically on demand.
task.fstrim.name: Filesystem TRIM
task.fstrim.desc: Runs fstrim to inform the virtual disk which blocks are free. Makes VHDX compaction dramatically more effective. Falls back to zero-filling free space if TRIM is not supported.
task.general-cache.name: Clean All User Caches
task.general-cache.desc: Blanket cleanup of the entire ~/.cache directory. Catches miscellaneous app caches not covered by other tasks.
task.man-pages.name: Remove Man Pages & Docs
task.man-pages.desc: Deletes offline manual pages, documentation, and info files from /usr/share. Saves 200–400 MB. Regenerated when packages are reinstalled.
task.locales.name: Remove Unused Locales
task.locales.desc: Removes all locale data except English from /usr/share/locale. Saves 100+ MB. Do not use if you need non-English locales.
task.python-bytecode.name: Remove Python Bytecode
task.python-bytecode.desc: Removes all __pycache__ directories and *.pyc files under /home. Rebuilt automatically on next import.
task.terraform-cache.name: Clean Terraform Plugin Cache
task.terraform-cache.desc: Removes Terraform provider/plugin caches from ~/.terraform.d/plugin-cache and project-level .terraform/providers. Providers can be 100–500 MB each. Re-downloaded on next terraform init.
task.minikube-cache.name: Clean Minikube Cache
task.minikube-cache.desc: Removes cached ISO images, Kubernetes binaries, and container images from ~/.minikube/cache. Can be 1–3 GB. Re-downloaded on next minikube start.
task.sbt-ivy-cache.name: Clean sbt / Ivy Cache
task.sbt-ivy-cache.desc: Removes Scala build caches from ~/.ivy2/cache and ~/.sbt/boot. Scala devs can accumulate 1–5 GB here. Re-downloaded on next build.
task.conan-cache.name: Clean Conan C++ Cache
task.conan-cache.desc: Removes Conan C++ package manager caches from ~/.conan/data and ~/.conan2/p. Can be 1–5 GB for active C++ projects. Re-downloaded on next build.
task.shell-history.name: Trim Shell History
task.shell-history.desc: Trims ~/.bash_history, ~/.zsh_history, and ~/.local/share/fish/fish_history to the last 10 MB. Only touches files larger than 10 MB.
distros.title: Distro Manager
distros.desc: Export, import, clone, and restart your WSL distributions. Compare size, packages, and uptime across all distros at a glance.
distros.col.name: Name
distros.cloneDesc: Create a copy of {distro} as a new distribution.
tray.title: System Tray
tray.desc: Minimize WSL Cleaner to the system tray for background monitoring with live stats.
tray.previewEmpty: Enable tray mode and select a distro to see a live preview.
alerts.title: Smart Alerts
alerts.desc: Get notified when your WSL environment needs attention. Alerts are checked each time tray stats update.
alerts.vhdxSize.title: VHDX Disk Size
alerts.vhdxSize.desc: Alert when VHDX file exceeds threshold.
alerts.memoryHigh.title: Memory Pressure
alerts.memoryHigh.desc: Alert when RAM usage exceeds threshold.
alerts.dockerSpace.title: Docker Containers
alerts.dockerSpace.desc: Alert when total Docker containers exceed threshold.
alerts.zombies.title: Zombie Processes
alerts.zombies.desc: Alert when zombie processes are detected.
alerts.systemdFail.title: Systemd Failed Units
alerts.dnsBroken.title: DNS Resolution Failure
alerts.dnsBroken.desc: Alert when DNS resolution fails inside WSL.
alerts.dnsBroken.notification: DNS resolution is failing inside WSL
